poem:
End of Questions

The final question mark unfurls,  
an exhale into the evening news,  
as voices fold like paper fans.  
In the silence left behind,  
ghosts of debate drift into ether,  
while fresh scripts thumb their edges,  
eager for their stage.  
A drama of loss sprouts,  
nurtured by the ink of change.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "ABC confirms Q+A to be axed amid wider changes and scores of redundancies across broadcaster The ABC’s Q+A program has been cancelled after 18 years, the broadcaster has confirmed, amid wider changes that will result in scores of redundancies across the public broadcaster. The round of changes will fund new programming at the ABC under reforms yet to be announced by the new managing director, Hugh Marks. Marks, who joined the ABC in March, is". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
